byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and RICHARD FAUSSET

abstract: Relief and jubilation wash over throngs of Baltimore residents upon news that Maryland State Atty Marilyn J Mosby is filing murder charges against six police officers linked to death of Freddie Gray; some people caution, however, that charges are only first step and prosecution is no guarantee that officers will be convicted.
lead_paragraph: Baltimore, gripped for days by anger over Freddie Gray’s death, was a scene of celebration over the prosecution of police officers, but some cautioned that charges do not guarantee a conviction.

headline.main: Baltimore’s Mood Shifts From Grim to Elated After Charges Are Announced
headline.print_headline: A City’s Mood Shifts From Grim to Elated After Charges Are Announced

snippet: Baltimore, gripped for days by anger over Freddie Gray’s death, was a scene of celebration over the prosecution of police officers, but some cautioned that charges do not guarantee a conviction.
